text: Rockets are coming in closer and closer
all the time this neighborhoods being
hit every few seconds we can see damage
up the road here and no people at all
it's a worry were just now is literally
around the corner there and there was a
pretty intense barrows going on it seems
to have gone quiet now we can still hear
the drones overhead and we've got to be
ready for the possibility that shelling
could start again very soon in that
direction the streets are completely
deserted but the further over this way
you go the more you find people are on
the streets in that direction you're
getting closer to Gaza City where things
are relatively safe further over here is
schedge area that's the area that was
being heavily bombarded yesterday that
was pretty much evacuated we saw the
people streaming out yesterday we're not
quite sure what the focus of Israeli
activity is today just yet this man here
doesn't want to be identified but he's
got a piece here of shrapnel that's from
some kind of artillery round or rocket
the sort that have been coming in quite
a lot in the last few minutes so what
that woman was saying is really typical
of the situation of an awful lot of
people here in Gaza at the moment her
home was in a dangerous area so she and
our kids fled to a UN school the UN says
more than 80,000 people are now
sheltering in its facilities but she
found that at the school the conditions
were really bad so she tried to go back
home to pick up some possessions and
maybe some food but she found it was too
dangerous to go back home so now she's
on her way back to the UN school people
are just going this way and that
throughout this dangerous area trying as
best they can to survive
